core

Class AntColony

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.AntColony

  • public class AntColony
extends java.lang.Object
    An entire colony of ants and their tunnels.
    Version:
    Fall 2014
    Author:
    Joel

    • Constructor Detail

      • AntColony

        public AntColony(int numTunnels,
                 int tunnelLength,
                 int moatFrequency,
                 int startingFood)
        Creates a new ant colony with the given layout.
        Parameters:
        numTunnels - The number of tunnels (paths)
        tunnelLength - The length of each tunnel
        moatFrequency - The frequency of which moats (water areas) appear. 0 means that there are no moats
        startingFood - The starting food for this colony.

    • Method Detail

      • getPlaces

        public core.Place[] getPlaces()
        Returns an array of Places in this colony. Places are ordered by tunnel, with each tunnel's places listed start to end.
        Returns:
        The tunnels in this colony

      • getBeeEntrances

        public core.Place[] getBeeEntrances()
        Returns an array of places that the bees can enter into the colony
        Returns:
        Places the bees can enter

      • getQueenPlace

        public core.Place getQueenPlace()
        Returns the queen's location
        Returns:
        The queen's location

      • getFood

        public int getFood()
        Returns the amount of available food
        Returns:
        the amount of available food

      • increaseFood

        public void increaseFood(int amount)
        Increases the amount of available food
        Parameters:
        amount - The amount to increase by

      • queenHasBees

        public boolean queenHasBees()
        Returns if there are any bees in the queen's location (and so the game should be lost)
        Returns:
        if there are any bees in the queen's location

      • deployAnt

        public void deployAnt(core.Place place,
                      core.Ant ant)
        Places the given ant in the given tunnel IF there is enough available food. Otherwise has no effect
        Parameters:
        place - Where to place the ant
        ant - The ant to place

      • removeAnt

        public void removeAnt(core.Place place)
        Removes the ant inhabiting the given Place
        Parameters:
        place - Where to remove the ant from

      • getAllAnts

        public java.util.ArrayList<core.Ant> getAllAnts()
        Returns a list of all the ants currently in the colony
        Returns:
        a list of all the ants currently in the colony
